update.description:
Adding `sdf::Battery` for `<battery>` tag under `<link>`.

This is dependency for porting LinearBatteryPlugin and LinearBatteryConsumerPlugin from Gazebo classic to Ignition. Tested in [the port](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/234/acropolis-port-battery-plugin-from-gazebo/diff).
update.title: [WIP] Add battery tag under link
update.reason: I’m going to decline this per recent discussions regarding ign-gazebo PR 234. We won’t be using SDF tags for battery, to be flexible to changes in the plugin implementation (as there are still features in the planning stage) and be independent to API/ABI.

content.raw: I’m going to decline this per recent discussions regarding ign-gazebo [PR 234](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/234/acropolis-port-battery-plugin-from-gazebo/diff). We won’t be using SDF tags for battery, to be flexible to changes in the plugin implementation \(as there are still features in the planning stage\) and be independent to API/ABI.
content.html: I’m going to decline this per recent discussions regarding ign-gazebo PR 234. We won’t be using SDF tags for battery, to be flexible to changes in the plugin implementation (as there are still features in the planning stage) and be independent to API/ABI.

content.raw: Let's wait. Moving to `<model>` probably means removal of the functions added to `Link.hh` here and putting them in Model.
content.html: Let's wait. Moving to <model> probably means removal of the functions added to Link.hh here and putting them in Model.

content.raw: if the move to `<model>` doesn't break API/ABI, we can merge this now; otherwise we should wait for the changes
content.html: if the move to <model> doesn't break API/ABI, we can merge this now; otherwise we should wait for the changes

content.raw: yeah, that's fine
content.html: yeah, that's fine

content.raw: This PR might actually change, since we decided to put battery under `<model>`, instead of `<link>` now… Maybe I should mark it WIP?
content.html: This PR might actually change, since we decided to put battery under <model>, instead of <link> now… Maybe I should mark it WIP?

content.raw:
I think we need a move assignment operator also if we have a move constructor (rule of 5)

`Battery &operator=(const Battery &&_battery)`

I think we need a move assignment operator also if we have a move constructor (rule of 5)

Battery &operator=(const Battery &&_battery)

content.raw: The test coverage for the new class is [currently 42%](https://codecov.io/bb/osrf/sdformat/src/6d6cf4b79262ecc68db8f3c8ea5a641572df1cf7/src/Battery.cc). Most of the other classes have over 80%, adding tests for copy / move construction, testing accessors and some `Load` cases should get us close to 100%.
content.html: The test coverage for the new class is currently 42%. Most of the other classes have over 80%, adding tests for copy / move construction, testing accessors and some Load cases should get us close to 100%.

content.raw: Missing doxygen
content.html: Missing doxygen

content.raw:
I think some classes still assign member by member, but we've been doing something like this for the new ones, which is less error prone:

~~~
Battery::Battery(const Battery &_battery)
  : dataPtr(new BatteryPrivate(*_battery.dataPtr))
{
}
~~~

The same goes for the assignment operator below:

~~~
  *this->dataPtr = (*_battery.dataPtr);
~~~

You can see [JointAxis](#!/osrf/sdformat/src/ef31dcd8a065c6d5d401cac16f05d41f834d5e2b/src/JointAxis.cc?at=sdf8&fileviewer=file-view-default#JointAxis.cc-82) for an example.
content.html:
I think some classes still assign member by member, but we've been doing something like this for the new ones, which is less error prone:

Battery::Battery(const Battery &_battery)
  : dataPtr(new BatteryPrivate(*_battery.dataPtr))
{
}

The same goes for the assignment operator below:

  *this->dataPtr = (*_battery.dataPtr);

You can see JointAxis for an example.

content.raw: Some "sensor" leftovers on the documentation
content.html: Some "sensor" leftovers on the documentation

Doxygen needs the next line after this to be occupied (I never looked into why), but we've been doing one of these:

  // Inline bracket to help doxygen filtering.
  inline namespace SDF_VERSION_NAMESPACE {
  //
  // Forward declarations.

or

  // Inline bracket to help doxygen filtering.
  inline namespace SDF_VERSION_NAMESPACE {
  //

  // Forward declarations.

or 

  // Inline bracket to help doxygen filtering.
  inline namespace SDF_VERSION_NAMESPACE {
  // Forward declarations.

content.raw: 2019 :wink:
content.html: 2019
